Willow Ufgood.Action: Beams with joy when children excitedly call him over and runs to them despite work.
Warns children to stay away from unknown baby for their safety, showing concern and caution.
Firmly refuses to keep the found baby, prioritizing safety and responsibility over sentimentality.
Instructs children to hide the baby from the Prefect, acting protectively but also fearfully.
Puts his arm around his wife with pride and defends their right to gather seeds in the forest.
Quickly hides behind the plow to avoid confrontation and then waits before running to the river when his wife screams.
Expresses anxiety about the consequences of keeping the baby but remains engaged and protective by watching over the child and interacting with the family.
Initially insists no one will fall in love with the baby, but his actions contradict this as he stays involved and concerned, showing underlying care despite initial resistance.
Refuses to involve authorities (Village Council) out of fear of blame and superstition, showing hesitation to seek help but motivated by protecting family and tradition.
Performs a magic trick for the village festival despite initial failure and embarrassment.
Acknowledges trouble to his friend Meegosh and accepts the situation sincerely.
Does not show resentment or anger towards those mocking him or the Village Council.
Attempts a magic trick involving making a pig disappear, employs clever sleight of hand (whipping pig under legs and behind back) to create the illusion.
Loses control of the pig when it bites his hand and escapes momentarily, causing the crowd to laugh and partly leave.
Despite initial failure, is able to impress the crowd briefly with the sleight of hand before the pig squeals and runs off.
Shows embarrassment and appears lacking confidence after the trick goes awry and the Village Council disapproves.
Acknowledges the trouble he is in with the Village Council and confides in his friend Meegosh.
Insists on speaking to High Aldwin about an important matter despite distraction and social pressure.
Leaves Meegosh, who is overwhelmed, alone to watch sugar-charged children and a pig.
Shrinks away embarrassed when Burglekutt publicly mocks his aspiration to be an apprentice.
Charges toward the Death Dog to protect Mims, tackles her away from danger.
Races to his farm to check on family and embraces Kiaya with relief.
Insists they must take the baby to the Council despite personal attachment.
Charges toward the baby running into danger and tackles her away from the Death Dog's claws.
Quickly realizes the threat and rushes toward his distant farm to check on his children and the baby.
Decides they cannot keep the baby and insists on taking her to the Council, showing practical judgment.
Tries to push through a hostile crowd while holding a found baby to protect her.
Insists the baby must not be given back to dangerous pursuers, showing concern for the child's safety despite the crowd's hostility.
Surprisingly pushes through a chaotic and hostile crowd while holding the baby, showing determination and care.
Speaks calmly and truthfully to the High Aldwin about finding the baby, providing crucial information despite the tense atmosphere.
Expresses concern for the baby's safety against the crowd's hostile attitude, showing empathy but possibly lacking influence to calm them.
Initially refuses to take the baby for practical reasons, showing reluctance.
Despite his hesitation and fear, he affirms that there is love in his heart for the child.
Hesitates and expresses reluctance to take responsibility by saying 'I can't do it! I haven't put my crop in!'
Despite doubt and reluctance, verbally affirms love and willingness to care for the child when asked by High Aldwin.
Diapers the baby and cares for his children tenderly, smiles and kisses them goodnight.
Listens patiently and responds gently to his children’s questions and fears.
Quietly withdraws after putting children to bed, showing a calm and sincere demeanor.
Hesitates before accepting responsibility, standing there staring at the baby instead of responding immediately.
Demonstrates careful attention to family duties by calmly diapering the baby and putting children to bed.
Responds patiently and thoughtfully to children's questions, showing emotional intelligence and calm composure.
Prepares for journey by packing supplies, carrying a dagger, and using papoose rig, indicating practical readiness.
Shakes head when asked if he knows where he is going, implying uncertainty about the path ahead.
Hugs the children playing tag among the stones before departing.
Kisses Kiaya and notices her cut hair before leaving.
Questions his own strength and expresses doubt about being able to complete the task.
Shows enthusiasm and desire to perform real magic, displaying motivation to learn and improve.
Accepts the serious mission and prepares to undertake it despite his doubts, indicating a willingness to act.
Accepts Kiaya's passionate embrace and emotional farewell.
Struggles to feed the hungry baby with goat's milk despite difficulties.
Protects the baby by clutching her and hiding when sensing danger.
Hides under the bridge when sensing danger from approaching soldiers.
Impulsively digs out goat's milk and struggles to feed the baby.
Quickly reacts to danger by clutching the baby and running to hide.
Shrinks back terrified after the violent death of the Death Dog and the baby's crying.
Apologizes to the baby after expressing frustration.
Cares for the baby despite his unease and frustration (e.g., changes diaper, builds safe fire area).
Repeatedly expresses dislike for the situation but persists in caring for the baby and continuing the journey.
Trips over a stone and almost falls flat on his face.
Maintains cautious awareness and looks over shoulder while traveling with the baby.
Recognizes the landmark of the crossroads from a distance and heads toward it cautiously.
Shows anxiety and discomfort about the environment but continues to wait and care for the baby despite unpleasant conditions.
Builds a fire from flint and blow, creates a makeshift crib for the baby to rest safely nearby.
Expresses repeated negative feelings by saying 'I hate this' multiple times without apparent solutions or attempts to improve situation.
Nods in reluctant agreement to Madmartigan's demand for water and races around picking up his belongings quickly.
Refuses to come near Madmartigan despite his threats and manipulations, showing caution.
Attempts to intimidate Madmartigan by claiming to be a powerful sorcerer and threatening to turn him into a toad.
Throws a rock at Madmartigan but it bounces off the cage, showing ineffective physical action.
Despite Madmartigan's provocations, stays emotionally distant and sarcastic rather than driven by fear or anger.
Offers goat's milk to Madmartigan despite his rough appearance, shows concern for the baby’s care.
Refuses to entrust Madmartigan with the baby because he is imprisoned for a reason, showing prudent caution.
Feeds the baby by the fire and is alert to approaching people, demonstrating care and vigilance.
Offers goat's milk to Madmartigan despite uncertain reactions.
Refuses to release Madmartigan from the cage despite his insistence, understanding there is a reason he is imprisoned.
Tosses more wood on the fire and picks up the baby when hearing approaching hoofbeats, initially reacting with excitement and alertness.
Fails to immediately follow Madmartigan’s urgent command to douse the fire, instead adding to it.
Quickly dives into the bushes to hide when danger approaches, showing quick reaction to threat.
Scrambles out of the bushes and throws dirt to help Madmartigan put out the flames
Asks Madmartigan if he is okay after rescuing him
Corrects Madmartigan when called 'Peck' and states his real name
Stares warily at Madmartigan’s hand but then shakes it quickly
Begins to walk away when Madmartigan licks his wounds and complains about the world
Scrambles out of the bushes and uses dirt to extinguish flames on Madmartigan's cage, helping to save him.
Begins to walk away after the rescue without further ensuring Madmartigan's condition or safety.
Hesitates and says 'I don't know' when asked if he wants to give his baby to the Picts, showing uncertainty and lack of decisiveness.
Chases the rat away from the baby and protects the child.
Refuses to free Madmartigan despite his pleading and eagerness, prioritizing caution.
Rocks the baby gently and cares for the child's safety.
Responds with concern and helps Madmartigan by treating his burns.
Turns his back on Madmartigan initially, ignoring his attempts to interact.
Smears healing goo on Madmartigan's arms and offers help.
Accepts a rattle made by Madmartigan for the baby without suspicion.
Shifts attention quickly to protect the baby when messengers appear, showing care and alertness.
Fishes gooey jelly from his sack and applies it to Madmartigan's arms to help soothe pain.
Quickly reacts to the approaching messengers by grabbing the baby and stepping out to stop them.
Asks Madmartigan questions about the situation (warrior status and the sounds of battle) showing situational awareness.
Jumps aside hastily when the first messenger thunders past, indicating caution and quick reflexes.
Waits quietly and does not attempt to engage or organize a response to the incoming army beyond alertness.
Holds the baby found in the village and tries to get the officer to take responsibility for the child.
Tries to get the officer's attention amid chaos, holds the baby carefully, approaches Airk directly to request help for the baby.
Scurries out of the way when an officer's horse nearly kicks him, showing quick reaction but also caution.
Asks Madmartigan if he is a friend to Airk, showing concern about relationships.
Expresses hatred for the situation (dead fire, harsh environment) with a straightforward, sincere statement.
Directly challenges Madmartigan's claim about caring for the baby, indicating protective nature and concern.
Shakes his head at the ashes of his dead fire, expressing frustration and sadness about the situation.
Responds realistically to Madmartigan's offer to take care of the baby by pointing out Madmartigan's ignorance about babies.
Passively allows Madmartigan to rant and banter without intervening or redirecting the conversation productively.
Insists Madmartigan promise to feed and care for the baby properly before freeing him, gives detailed instructions, kisses the baby goodbye, and entrusts her to Madmartigan's care.
Watches Madmartigan and the baby leave, sighs with relief, seeming content that his task is done.
Struts proudly, humorously praising himself in a friendly and self-deprecating way.
Shouts and waves madly chasing after the vulture carrying the baby, showing concern and protectiveness.
Takes care to avoid traps when chasing the vulture and shows quick thinking.
Sighs with relief after task accomplished, struts proudly.
Responds quickly to baby being taken by vulture, shouts and chases after it.
Notices the fork in path and recognizes a trap, avoids it accordingly.
Takes safer route to avoid trap but ends up falling into a deadly pit.
Insists that the baby is his responsibility despite being bound and mistreated.
Expresses regret for trusting Madmartigan after being attacked.
Accepts Teemo’s help without argument when groggy.
Struggles against ropes when bound and remains focused on responsibility for the baby.
Loses consciousness after being pricked with poison despite trying to stay alert.
Responds groggily but cooperates with rescuers, allowing them to help him recover.
Rolls onto his knees, stands up, and squeezes through narrow space behind brownies.
Questions why the baby is crying and why elves torment babies to collect tears.
Decides to get the baby out of the room despite warnings from others.
Comes crashing into the Elfin Tear Factory with force and impact, taking decisive action.
Grabs the crying baby and carries her to safety despite danger.
Expresses fear and reluctance to cross the dangerous gorge with the baby but still tries to do so.
Grabs the crying baby and carries her while escaping from pursuing elves, ventures cautiously onto a precarious fallen tree despite vertigo.
Expresses fear and hesitation about crossing the fallen tree with the baby, indicating self-awareness of his limitations.
Wobbles like a drunken tightrope walker and needs encouragement from the brownies.
Races to catch the baby falling from the papoose, saving her from plummeting into the gorge.
Hobbles along, carrying and protecting the baby, showing care and perseverance despite injury.
Expresses concern about the situation ('This is not going well.').
Quietly observes and respects the magical beings, allowing them to guide him without complaint.
Races the troll and grabs the baby just before she plummets into the gorge.
Hauls himself to safety despite the danger and injury (bootless foot) from a burning, crashing tree.
Follows the brownies into the forest while hobbling on a bootless foot, continuing the mission despite injury.
Expresses defeat by saying, 'This is not going well.'
Accepts the queen's hospitality and drink with polite gratitude despite being momentarily blinded by bright light.
Shows some hesitation and silence initially when addressed by the queen, indicating deference and perhaps humility rather than arrogance.
Remains mostly silent and disoriented when confronted with the dazzling presence of the Fairy Queen, struggling to see her clearly.
Accepts the offerings of the court (drink in a delicate cup-shaped leaf) calmly, showing some composure under unfamiliar circumstances.
Engages in limited dialogue, asking if the queen knows who the baby belongs to, indicating a basic awareness of the significance of the situation.
Starts to get up after the queen finishes speaking, showing some initiative to move forward after receiving important information.
Expresses doubt about his importance and ability to undertake the task, highlighting humility and self-awareness.
Shows frustration and confusion but remains engaged with the Fairy Queen’s riddles and instructions.
Remarks on his physical stature with a hint of self-deprecation but without bitterness.
Questions the Fairy Queen about the mission and expresses confusion about the instructions.
Shows self-doubt by stating he is nobody and highlighting his physical shortcomings.
Tries to be logical by suggesting a warrior would be needed for the job, while recognizing his own perceived limitations.
Expresses concern for his family while receiving a dangerous magical gift, showing his responsibility and sincerity.
Struggles with conscience but ultimately accepts a difficult task for the greater good, indicating trustworthiness and good-natured resolve.
Carefully examines the magical acorns, asks clarifying questions about their power, shows cautious skepticism before accepting their significance.
Expresses concern about family responsibilities before committing to the dangerous task.
Ultimately resolves to accept the challenge and take responsibility despite fears, showing determination and mature decision-making.
Accepts the challenge to help the fairies despite fear.
Expresses excitement about sharing his experience with his children, showing a sense of connection and sincerity.
Watches the battle with disgust at the violence, indicating empathy and moral sensitivity.
Frozen in fear as danger approaches and fails to act to protect others at that moment.
Volunteers to undertake a difficult task despite apparent limitations (only having one shoe), showing resolve and determination.
Curiously experiments with a magic acorn, showing some initiative to understand new tools.
Observes the battle from a vantage point and recognizes the dire situation with disgust, demonstrating awareness.
Freezes in fear when suddenly surrounded by enemy horsemen, nearly getting himself and the baby trampled.
Digs the baby out of the papoose quickly after falling and protects her while running along the tree-line in a dangerous situation.
Confidently decides to enter a rough tavern full of threatening people claiming 'I'm a sorcerer. What could possibly happen?'
Attempts to ask for milk for the baby despite hostile and threatening patrons, then quickly takes cover when attacked.
Silences the baby gently and bravely retrieves milk near roughnecks to care for the baby.
Feeds the baby soaked rag, showing concern for its well-being.
Trusts Madmartigan despite questionable company and danger.
Silences baby with finger and cautiously retrieves milk from near Roughnecks, then quickly returns with it.
Accidentally falls through a wall, indicating a lapse in caution or awareness.
Defends the baby when Madmartigan tries to take her, swipes at him, insists on her role as nursemaid, and shows concern for the baby.
Uses mischievous humor (joking about changing baby's diaper) in a tense situation.
Refuses to let Sorsha see the baby, insists she is sick to protect the child.
Dives out the window after Madmartigan to help in the escape.
Intervenes decisively by blocking Sorsha from seeing the baby, assertively saying 'No! You can't!'
Follows Madmartigan by diving out the window in the chaotic fight, showing quick reaction and commitment to the group's safety.
Flinging himself off the balcony to continue pursuit and dropping the brownies into the wagon to aid escape.
Successfully crawling up to hum and taking the baby from Madmartigan during the chase, showing awareness and protective behavior.
Hugging the baby protectively while anticipating the threats closing in, demonstrating situational awareness.
No indication of poor decision-making or hesitation in this excerpt.
Harnesses the baby to his chest and grabs the reins, trying to manage the wagon during a dangerous fight.
Swerves the wagon to fend off the Death Dog that threatens the baby.
Scurries under the wagon seat to protect himself and the baby from immediate danger.
Yanks the reins and swerves the wagon into the attacking Death Dog, causing it to yelp and momentarily retreat.
Fails to anticipate or avoid the exposed tree root, resulting in being dumped onto the wagon floor and nearly going overboard.
Scurries under the wagon seat to protect the baby when the Death Dog boards the wagon, showing quick reaction under pressure.
Tries to stop the horse to avoid danger.
Immediately concerned about the baby's safety and starts digging through debris to find her.
Whips the reins and looks over his shoulder to assess the oncoming danger of the war chariot.
Tries to stop the horse despite the collapsing wheel, ultimately being thrown off into a ditch.
Immediately jumps up and urgently checks for the baby's safety after the crash.
Races to dig through the rubble with Madmartigan in search of the baby based on the brownies’ indication.
Rips open the papoose to check on Elora Danan, shows immediate concern and relief when the baby giggles and smiles.
Affirms Madmartigan's role in saving the baby despite his boasting, showing trust and friendliness.
Bundles the baby carefully and urges to leave quickly for safety, showing protectiveness and responsibility.
Places trust in the Fairy Queen and defends the belief in Tir Asleen against Madmartigan's skepticism.
Touches Kiaya's necklace with sadness, indicating deep emotional connection and sincerity.
Immediately recognizes the importance of the baby and acts quickly to check her condition and ensure her safety.
Decides to leave quickly before the pursuers return, showing situational awareness and prudent risk avoidance.
Tends to the baby carefully at the campfire, demonstrating responsibility and care.
Passively reacts to Madmartigan's mocking and sarcastic remarks without confrontation or clear rebuttal.
Expresses anger and frustration by accusing Madmartigan of being a coward and fake warrior.
Vents his feelings openly and vulnerably, admitting he misses his family and expressing deep love for them.
Shows emotional exhaustion and sincerity in his interaction, revealing his inner pain honestly.
Stares angrily and confronts Madmartigan, trying to motivate him to act despite danger.
Loses composure, explodes emotionally, calls Madmartigan coward, kicks his boot, throws rock wildly.
Expresses deep personal feelings and vulnerability, admits missing family which shows emotional honesty but not strategic mindset.
Sits on ground exhausted after emotional outburst, showing momentary loss of energy and control.
Wakes up concerned and panics when the baby is missing, then actively searches for Madmartigan and the baby.
Watches Madmartigan gently rocking the baby and shows curiosity, indicating attentive and caring nature.
Engages cooperatively with Madmartigan and the brownies to figure out how to reach the island, showing open-mindedness and team spirit.
Panics when the baby is missing and scrambles to find them.
Observes surroundings carefully after waking up and quickly tries to find the missing baby.
Asks a relevant question about how to reach the island, showing problem awareness.
Approaches the wary golden-haired boy despite Madmartigan's distrust, calmly accepts the boy's decision to disappear, and confidently leads the group toward the island seeking Fin Raziel.
Approaches an unknown boy who warns them of danger with calmness and rationality, seeking guidance from the brownies before making a decision to proceed.
Decides to risk going to the cursed island despite warnings, showing confidence and decisive leadership.
Trusts the advice of the brownies and weighs the importance of their mission logically.
Calmly communicates with Raziel despite her hostile and unusual appearance, showing patience and respect.
Shows concern and determination to help the baby princess by seeking Raziel's assistance.
Questions the situation openly without frustration or anger, demonstrating tolerance for the unexpected.
Calmly attempts to communicate with Raziel despite confusion and unusual behavior, shows patience and presence of mind.
Recognizes the significance of Raziel's reaction to the baby's mark, connecting it to Elora Danan.
Does not seem to interpret the magical nature of the tree or react quickly to Madmartigan stripping bark, missing a risky or critical detail.
Recognizes the danger and urges to leave the island quickly for safety.

Intervenes to prevent Madmartigan from killing the water boy despite Raziel's urging.

Panics when the baby Raziel is taken by Sorsha, showing concern and emotional investment.

Panics when Sorsha and her men capture Raziel and take the baby from him.
Loses strength, falls and is dragged during captivity.
Relies on Madmartigan who carries him on his shoulders.
Responds honestly when Raziel questions his magical abilities.
Loses strength and cannot continue, needing to be carried; fails to use magic to escape captivity.
Successfully turned a monster into stone previously, demonstrating magical ability.
Expresses self-doubt and inability to take action when imprisoned.
Volunteers to help Raziel without hesitation.
Offers practical advice to soothe the crying baby.

Offers to help Raziel when asked, eagerly accepts opportunity to learn magic.
Calms the crying baby by suggesting a practical method to soothe her.

Expresses concern about a crying baby nearby ('I hope she's all right.')

Pulls a strand of his hair and frowns, showing engagement and attentiveness to the magical task.
Listens carefully and recites the magical teaching, demonstrating willingness to learn and memorize complex information.
Questions the process and reflects on its meaning, indicative of thoughtful and intelligent behavior.
Despite being chained and in captivity, continues to work by grinding the substance diligently.

No clear failure or incompetence present in this excerpt.

Quickly hides the powder in his pocket when bootsteps approach, demonstrating quick thinking and awareness.
Changes the crying baby successfully after Sorsha fails, showing practical skill and calm under pressure.

Smiles reassuringly at Sorsha while caring for the baby.

Grins and lightheartedly banters with Madmartigan about love.

Accepts the baby from Sorsha with care and attentiveness.

Observes King Kael's violent behavior and feels anger.

Watches events unfold and listens closely alongside Madmartigan.
Agrees to complete the philosopher's stone to help Raziel despite the danger.

Acts calmly despite being bitten and bleeding, showing trust and composure.

Reacts impressed by Madmartigan's skill, acknowledging another's ability with friendliness.

Is unconscious after being rescued from the snowball crash.
Holds the baby tight and buries the baby in his chest to protect it during a dangerous search by soldiers.

Steps forward to protectively and proudly identify Elora Danan as the princess, showing his care and responsibility.
Looks up hopefully to Raziel when Raziel warns they are not safe, showing trust and openness.

Relies on Raziel's assertions about Tir Asleen's existence despite opposition and skepticism from Airk.

Relies on others (villagers) to help mount the pony and prepare provisions, indicating some lack of independent skill or experience.

Laughs with Madmartigan to ease tension despite the dangerous situation.

Follows Raziel into a dangerous cave despite obvious hazards, showing willingness to face fear.
Admits discomfort in closed spaces but continues on steadily, demonstrating perseverance.
Carries Elora in a papoose himself, showing responsibility and practical care.
Trusts Raziel’s guidance unquestioningly despite uncertainties, showing some naivety or overconfidence.

Shows vulnerability by admitting he is still learning magic and needs practice.
Respects Madmartigan's command to run and acts on it, trusting him.

Scoops up the baby and runs for cover during an attack.

Covers Raziel's unclothed body with a simple smock, demonstrates care and awareness.
Opens the tent to bring in pigs for transformation back into warriors as instructed by Raziel.

Sits silently and scratches the ground before speaking, indicating careful thought before acting.

Volunteers to face danger alongside Raziel despite the risks.

Sneaks into a dangerous enemy stronghold to rescue the baby, despite obvious fear.

Stands firmly against Bavmorda, refuses to give up the child, demonstrating protective and sincere behavior.

Humbly accepts the Book of Sorcery with a grateful smile.
Rides confidently into his village proudly carrying the sacred book and receives approval and celebration from his people.
Shares warm, grateful, and humble interactions with others, such as shaking hands warmly and presenting the book to High Aldwin.
No indication of hesitation or confusion during the homecoming and farewell moments, showing emotional composure and confidence.
